metadata.Title: CVE-2015-2756 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
QEMU, as used in Xen 3.3.x through 4.5.x, does not properly restrict accessto PCI command registers, which might allow local HVM guest users to causea denial of service (non-maskable interrupt and host crash) by disablingthe (1) memory or (2) I/O decoding for a PCI Express device and thenaccessing the device, which triggers an Unsupported Request (UR) response.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2756` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xen-utils-common - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
xenstore-utils - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.5').
qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.11').
